intro: Dombeya xiphosepalopsis, commonly known as the white dombeya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features a shrub-like structure with smooth, grey-green leaves and produces distinctive, spurred sepals that give it its scientific name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
